intro: Erigeron tridactylus, commonly known as the three-finger fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert environments. Erigeron tridactylus is adapted to arid conditions and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
